descriptions: Teams net points while player is on the court.
Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description: Lee Nailon hit a 20-foot jumper as time expired to give the Charlotte Hornets a 73-72 victory over the Houston Rockets on Friday night.
article.headline: Francis out with migraine, Nailon hits game-winner
article.linkText: Hornets' Nailon really gives Rockets a headache
article.story:
HOUSTON (AP) -- It had been a long time since Lee Nailon hit a game-winning shot. He hadn't forgotten how to make one. Nailon hit a 20-footer as time expired to give the Charlotte Hornets a 73-72 victory over the Houston Rockets on Friday night. "I've never had (a game-winner at the buzzer) in the NBA," Nailon said. "The play was going to Elden (Campbell) and they deflected the (inbounds) pass. I looked at the clock and saw there were two seconds left and I just tried to get a shot up. "I was wide open. I don't know how I was so wide open." The Rockets were expecting the shot to be taken by Campbell, who led the Hornets with 21 points and nine rebounds. Kelvin Cato deflected the pass and the ball bounced to Nailon. "Elden tried to tip it out to Lee," coach Paul Silas said. "Elden played a terrific game. He led the charge early and late in the game, he had two huge offensive rebounds. If we don't get those rebounds, we lose." The Rockets couldn't believe their sudden misfortune after leading 72-71 on Kenny Thomas' two free throws with five seconds to play. "I'm supposed to knock the ball away on that play," Cato said. "I did what the coaching staff asked. I thought the clock was going to run out when they couldn't pick it up. It was a long five seconds. "But it's part of the game. He just made a great shot." The Hornets felt a little strange winning that way. "Houston always plays that way," said Baron Davis, who had 16 points and 10 assists. "They always come back on you and play it close. But they just had bad luck tonight. We're usually the team with the bad luck. But tonight the luck was reversed." Coach Rudy Tomjanovich, whose team has been involved in 23 games decided by five points or less and has won only eight of them, agreed. "What's new? It was another unbelievable exciting game," Tomjanovich said. "It's a tough way to lose. But I'll take it that way. Cato did a great job (of deflecting the pass). Good defense created a chaotic situation there at the end of the game." Cuttino Mobley scored 23 points for the Rockets, who fell to 1-19 with Steve Francis out of the lineup. The All-Star guard sat out with a migraine headache for the third time in the last two weeks. Houston is 14-13 with Francis in the lineup. The Hornets led 58-50 entering the fourth quarter. But Moochie Norris's 15-foot jumper completed a 13-4 run that gave the Rockets a 70-66 lead with 2:34 to play. Campbell then hit a pair of free throws with 1:15 to play and Nailon hit a 15-foot jump shot to tie it at 70-70 with 20 seconds to play. Stacey Augmon hit one of two free throws to give Charlotte a 71-70 lead with 18 seconds to play before Thomas hit his free throws. Charlotte went on an 8-2 run the final three minutes to take a 22-15 lead after one quarter. Campbell led the way with 12 points on 6-of-7 shooting. The Hornets gradually expanded the lead to as many as 14 points midway through the second quarter. But Houston outscored them 7-0 over a three-minute span to close the gap to 35-28 with 2:53 left in the half. Charlotte maintained a 40-35 halftime lead as Campbell had 15 points. A 9-2 sprint highlighted by back-to-back 3-pointers by Mobley enabled Houston to tie it at 44-44 with 6:09 left in the third quarter. But Charlotte then reeled off 11 unanswered points over the next three minutes to take a 55-44 lead. Houston shot only 5-of-21 in the third quarter and the Hornets led 58-50 after three. Mobley hit back-to-back 3s to give Houston its first lead since early in the game, 63-62 with 6:29 remaining.

Game notes
The Rockets are 2-8 in the first game of back-to-backs and 2-8 in second games. ... David Wesley missed the game with a sore left ankle. He is day-to-day. Nailon moved from starting forward to guard and George Lynch started at forward.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
